title: Police identify teenage girl killed in drive-by shooting at KCK apartment complex
content:
KANSAS CITY, KS (KCTV) -
Police have identified the teenage girl who was killed after someone fired multiple shots at a KCK apartment complex.
Brannae Browne, 15, of Kansas City, KS was shot and killed as many other children played nearby.
Two others have minor injuries from the shooting that happened just after 6:30 p.m. Friday at Chelsea Plaza apartments near Fifth Street and Freeman Avenue.
Kansas City, KS police officers hugged crying grandmothers and mothers as they mourn another child shot in their community.
Witnesses tried to pull the victim inside the apartments to protect her from more gunfire.
"They are cruel, cowards, punks ... all those people live in that apartment building. Innocent by standers," said Krystal DePriest, a grandmother who also lost her granddaughter, Machole Stewart, to a separate drive-by shooting
The large crowd that gathered was filled with tearful women and children. Police officers hugged and tried to console them.
"You are a heartless person and you got to deal with God. You come out here and shoot up that building with all of those apartments in that building. You could have killed numerous people. You are very heartless. Your family and everyone who knows you did this, you need to drive to the police department and turn them in," DePriest said.
Police need help to get the killer off the streets. They need people who are fed up to speak up. If you have any information, call the TIPS Hotline at 816-474-TIPS.
